thread.title: Hurricanes claim win over False River
thread.title_full: Hurricanes claim win over False River

title: Hurricanes claim win over False River
text:
Hurricanes claim win over False River Bobby Ardoin, Special to the Daily World 5:26 p.m. CDT October 18, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
It’s been time stamped as one of the top annual rivalry games in St. Landry Parish. 
There’s Port Barre-Opelousas Catholic, Eunice-Northwest High and St. Edmund-Opelousas Catholic. 
Now it’s Opelousas and Beau Chene, two Class 4A schools that draw students from adjoining areas and have played one another almost continuously since the early 1990’s. 
The two schools meet again, this time in a Class 4-4A district contest on Friday night at Donald Gardner Stadium. 
Both have had difficult starts in their first two district games. 
Opelousas and Beau Chene are both 0-2 in 4-4A and have only scored one touchdown between them since beginning respective league contests two weeks ago. 
Beau Chene has been outscored 125-0 so far and for Opelousas, the collective scores are 99-8. 
There was a time early in the series when Opelousas was the dominant team. 
That’s changed over the past six seasons. 
Since Josh Guidry took over the Beau Chene program in 2013, Beau Chene has not lost to the Tigers. Two years ago the Gators used a block punt to spark a 12-8 win in a game played at Prairie Basse. 
Last year at Donald Gardner, it wasn’t close, as Beau Chene defeated the Tigers 23-6. 
Opelousas defeated Beau Chene 29-0 in 2012 for the Tigers’ last win in the rivalry. Since 2009 Opelousas is 2-4 against the Gators. 
North Central Claims First Win 
The North Central Hurricanes achieved their first win of the season Friday night with a 40-26 Class 5-1A victory at False River. 
It was the first district victory for North Central since the 2010 season when the Hurricanes defeated Sacred Heart. 
North Central’s victory also produced the most points the Hurricanes (1-6, 1-1) have scored this season. Entering the game with False River 2-5, 0-2), North Central was averaging less than a touchdown per game. 
The Hurricanes have a tough contest ahead this Friday night as they again travel to Pointe Coupee Parish. This time North Central meets Catholic Pointe-Coupee, which is tied for the league lead with Basile. Both of those teams are 2-0 in district games. 
Eunice and Church Point 
Perhaps the area’s most attractive matchup is scheduled for this Friday night in Church Point where the host Bears and Eunice – the two leaders in District 5-3A – meet in a crucial league game. 
Both are 6-1 and 2-0 in league contests. 
Each team also has a penchant for scoring points. 
Church Point has been held to two touchdowns only once in seven games. Otherwise the Bears in their six other games have scored an average of 40 points. 
Eunice has also displayed somewhat of a scoring matchine. 
In the Bobcats’ seven games they have averaged 35.8 points. 
Eunice has outscored their two district opponents 90-25. For Church Point it’s been much the same, as the Bears have outscored 5-3A teams 87-18. 
Area Week 8 Schedule 
Sacred Heart (2-5, 1-3) at West St. Mary (1-6, 1-3) 
Friday’s Games 
Beau Chene (4-3, 0-2) at Opelousas (0-7, 0-2) 
Eunice (6-1, 2-0) at Church Point (6-1, 2-0) 
Ville Platte (4-3, 1-1) at Northwest (5-2, 1-1) 
Pine Prairie (3-4, 0-2) at Port Barre (4-3, 0-2) 
Opelousas Catholic (5-2, 3-1) at Catholic-NI (5-2, 4-0) 
False River (1-6, 0-2) at Basile (6-1, 2-0) 
St. Edmund (2-5, 1-1) at Westminster (4-3, 0-2) 
North Central (1-6, 1-1) at Catholic PC (4-3, 2-0) Read or Share this story: http://www.dailyworld.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/18/hurricanes-claim-win-false-river/74190460/ TOP VIDEOS
